brief.brief: The record from the table specified in the Table name (tz.table.name) field that will contain the time zone value.

detail.detail: The Unique Key Value (tz.table.match.field) field contains the value of the unique key that identifies the record within the file specified in the Table Name (tz.table.name) field where the time zone (to use in calculating the alert time) is stored.

Service Manager uses this field, along with the Table Name (tz.table.name) field and the Unique Key Field Name (tz.table.field) field, in building the query to retrieve the record where the time zone (to use in calculating the alert time) is stored. This field is labeled "Name of record to query for" in the Time Zone tab of the AlertDef display format.
For example, assume that the desired time zone is stored in the file as described:
Field name of the unique key to the file: timeZoneID
Value that uniquely identifies the record: "abcde"
Name of the field that stores the time zone: theTimeZone
To instruct Service Manager on how to retrieve this particular time zone, specify the following in the Time Zone tab of the AlertDef format:
Unique field name in table (Unique Key Field Name, tz.table.field): timeZoneID
Name of record to query for (Unique Key Value, tz.table.match.field): abcde
Field name containing time zone value (Time Zone Field Name, tz.table.tzfield): theTimeZone
